name: Kawaihiko and the third-quartile day [traffic management]
description:
The Kawaihiko network, linking the New Zealand Universities to the Internet, pioneered traffic
measurement as a tool for network management and cost recovery. Its history and its use of
the Realtime Traffic Flow Measurement (RTFM) architecture to measure its traffic are
described.

The Kawaihiko members wanted a 'measured bandwidth' metric which would be a good
indicator of the bandwidth required to carry each site's traffic. Kawaihiko developed such a
metric - the Third-Quartile Day (3QD) - based on a daily usage profile or Third-Quartile Profile
(3QP). 3QP and 3QD are described in detail, and illustrated with typical plots from several of
the Kawaihiko sites.

The Kawaihiko members found 3QD to be an effective bandwidth measure, and 3QP a useful
traffic management tool.
